sentences.text:
When I launch 'advi' without arguments to display the help file
/usr/lib/advi/splash.dvi, the program crashes when I press '<' or '>'
to resize the text.

This happens nearly every time I press those keys, but it also worked
correctly once.
It seems that when I press '<' it terminates with this output:
Fatal error when running: Xlib error: BadPixmap (invalid Pixmap parameter)

Warning: Graphics.Graphic_failure("Xlib error: BadPixmap (invalid Pixmap parameter)")
  Segmenteringsfel
However when I press '>', it terminates with a different message:
Fatal error when running: Xlib error: BadDrawable (invalid Pixmap or Window parameter)

I tried this on two systems, both i386 running Debian testing with
some packages from unstable.
Versions of packages advi depends on:

ii  gs                       8.15-2          Transitional package
ii  gs-esp [gs]              7.07.1-9        The Ghostscript PostScript interpr
ii  gs-gpl [gs]              8.15-2          The GPL Ghostscript PostScript int
ii  libc6                    2.3.5-3         GNU C Library: Shared libraries an
ii  libfreetype6             2.1.7-2.4       FreeType 2 font engine, shared lib
ii  libice6                  4.3.0.dfsg.1-14 Inter-Client Exchange library
ii  libjpeg62                6b-10           The Independent JPEG Group's JPEG 
ii  libpng12-0               1.2.8rel-1      PNG library - runtime
ii  libsm6                   4.3.0.dfsg.1-14 X Window System Session Management
ii  libtiff4                 3.7.3-1         Tag Image File Format (TIFF) libra
ii  libungif4g               4.1.3-3         shared library for GIF images (run
ii  libx11-6                 4.3.0.dfsg.1-14 X Window System protocol client li
ii  libxext6                 4.3.0.dfsg.1-14 X Window System miscellaneous exte
ii  libxpm4                  4.3.0.dfsg.1-14 X pixmap library
ii  tetex-bin                2.0.2-30        The teTeX binary files
ii  xlibs                    4.3.0.dfsg.1-14 X Keyboard Extension (XKB) configu
ii  zlib1g                   1:1.2.2-4       compression library - runtime
On Fri, Aug 19, 2005 at 03:26:30PM +0200, marcus@better.se wrote:

> When I launch 'advi' without arguments to display the help file
> /usr/lib/advi/splash.dvi, the program crashes when I press '<' or '>'
> to resize the text.

>   Fatal error when running: Xlib error: BadPixmap (invalid Pixmap parameter)
>

>   Warning: Graphics.Graphic_failure("Xlib error: BadPixmap (invalid Pixmap parameter)")
>   Segmenteringsfel
> However when I press '>', it terminates with a different message:

>   Fatal error when running: Xlib error: BadDrawable (invalid Pixmap or Window parameter)
>

> I tried this on two systems, both i386 running Debian testing with
> some packages from unstable.

I do not see this exact pattern associated with > and <, but the
messages are the same.

Sometimes it prints Segemtation fault,
sometimes it does not.
On Fri, Aug 19, 2005 at 05:24:08PM +0200, Helge Kreutzmann wrote:
> On Fri, Aug 19, 2005 at 03:26:30PM +0200, marcus@better.se wrote:

> > When I launch 'advi' without arguments to display the help file
> > /usr/lib/advi/splash.dvi, the program crashes when I press '<' or '>'
> > to resize the text.

> >   Fatal error when running: Xlib error: BadPixmap (invalid Pixmap parameter)
> >

> >   Warning: Graphics.Graphic_failure("Xlib error: BadPixmap (invalid Pixmap parameter)")
> >   Segmenteringsfel
> > However when I press '>', it terminates with a different message:

> >   Fatal error when running: Xlib error: BadDrawable (invalid Pixmap or Window parameter)
> >

> > I tried this on two systems, both i386 running Debian testing with
> > some packages from unstable.

> I do not see this exact pattern associated with > and <, but the
> messages are the same.

Sometimes it prints Segemtation fault,
> sometimes it does not.
On Sat, Aug 20, 2005 at 09:12:36AM +0200, Sven Luther wrote:
I reubuild the unstripped version and run it in gdb.

In the first run,
I had no stack (as I told, it sometimes dies without printing
segmentation fault).

Then, using both > and <, I constantly got a
segmentation fault.

I attached the gdb log, but I don't know if it'll
help.
On Sat, Aug 20, 2005 at 10:07:30AM +0200, Helge Kreutzmann wrote:
> On Sat, Aug 20, 2005 at 09:12:36AM +0200, Sven Luther wrote:
> I reubuild the unstripped version and run it in gdb.

In the first run,
> I had no stack (as I told, it sometimes dies without printing
> segmentation fault).

Then, using both > and <, I constantly got a
> segmentation fault.

I attached the gdb log, but I don't know if it'll
> help.
Mmm, let's take this one upstream, can you forward it there, please ?
On Sat, Aug 20, 2005 at 10:15:17AM +0200, Sven Luther wrote:
> Mmm, let's take this one upstream, can you forward it there, please ?

Well, since I've never dealt with upstream and I just wanted to
confirm the bug I think it is better if you do it.
On Sat, Aug 20, 2005 at 02:18:52PM +0200, Helge Kreutzmann wrote:
> On Sat, Aug 20, 2005 at 10:15:17AM +0200, Sven Luther wrote:
> > Mmm, let's take this one upstream, can you forward it there, please ?

> Well, since I've never dealt with upstream and I just wanted to
> confirm the bug I think it is better if you do it.
Could you get a look at this bug report, which seems rather strange to me ?
On Fri, Aug 19, 2005 at 05:24:08PM +0200, Helge Kreutzmann wrote:
> On Fri, Aug 19, 2005 at 03:26:30PM +0200, marcus@better.se wrote:

> > When I launch 'advi' without arguments to display the help file
> > /usr/lib/advi/splash.dvi, the program crashes when I press '<' or '>'
> > to resize the text.

> >   Fatal error when running: Xlib error: BadPixmap (invalid Pixmap parameter)
> >

> >   Warning: Graphics.Graphic_failure("Xlib error: BadPixmap (invalid Pixmap parameter)")
> >   Segmenteringsfel
> > However when I press '>', it terminates with a different message:

> >   Fatal error when running: Xlib error: BadDrawable (invalid Pixmap or Window parameter)
> >

> > I tried this on two systems, both i386 running Debian testing with
> > some packages from unstable.

> I do not see this exact pattern associated with > and <, but the
> messages are the same.

Sometimes it prints Segemtation fault,
> sometimes it does not.

We believe that the bug you reported is fixed in the latest version of
advi, which is due to be installed in the Debian FTP archive:

A summary of the changes between this version and the previous one is
attached.
Thank you for reporting the bug, which will now be closed.

If you
have further comments please address them to 323963@bugs.debian.org,
and the maintainer will reopen the bug report if appropriate.
Ralf Treinen <treinen@debian.org> (supplier of updated advi package)

(This message was generated automatically at their request; if you
believe that there is a problem with it please contact the archive
administrators by mailing ftpmaster@debian.org)

Maintainer: Debian OCaml Maintainers <debian-ocaml-maint@lists.debian.org>
Changed-By: Ralf Treinen <treinen@debian.org>
advi       - an active DVI previewer and presenter

advi-examples - example presentations for Active-DVI (advi)
Closes: 323963 452044

This version closes a bug concerning embedded
     postscript images (closes: #452044) and with the scaling of the display
     (closes: #323963).

* Upstream distributes again the examples/ subtree, install it instead
     of our old copy in debian/examples-source. Remove from
debian/examples-source the old copies of examples and test/.
* patch doc-without-htmlc: do not call htmlc for building the doc

* patch examples-no-check: add phony check target in examples/Makefile
     since this is called recursively on all subdirs from the toplevel
     Makefile.

* Build-dependencies: put back some dependencies since upstream makefile
     does again rebuild the doc: hevea, texlive-latex-base, texlive-pstricks,
     texlive-latex-recommended, texlive-pictures.

* patch use-ghostscript: make configure believe that ghostscript is installed
     at compilation time.
* debian/rules: also make the splash.dvi documents in doc/
* debian/control: Updated location of upstream homepage
